key_assumptions: Gen Z continues to over-index on social discovery and mobile booking
Advisor usage/preference among Gen Z converts into actual purchase in the teens (%) near-term
Advisor planning fees remain mainstream (>50% of advisors charge) with $100–$300 common
Supplier commission bands hold: hotels/cruise 10–16%, tours 10–15%, air negligible

pain_severity.summary: High information overload + disruption anxiety. Gen Z wants curated experiences, perks, and rescue when things go sideways.
quantification: U.S. agency-channel air sales hit ~$100.4B in 2025, a record, signaling strong intermediary demand; NDC adds complexity (~21% of ARC-settled transactions in Dec’25).
8 in 10 U.S. adults plan to vacation in next 12 months; avg vacation budget ~$5,051 and ~4.1 trips/person (late-2024 study for 2025).
Social discovery rises: U.S. social use in trip research ~19% in 2025 (up from ~16% in 2023); Gen Z most influenced by social/influencers.
AI planning adoption growing: ~39% of travelers used AI for research/planning by 2H’25; Gen Z adoption near millennials.

1_problem_and_demand.problem_frequency: Trip planning occurs multiple times/year (median 3–4 trips), with research/decision loops across social, search, and OTAs; disruptions (delays/cancellations) remain common, requiring support.
existing_spend: Agency-channel market size (U.S.) revenue ~$46–47B in 2025; agency air gross ~$100B+; cruise/tour/hotel via agencies add tens of billions more.
Gen Z/young traveler package/group budgets center ~$2,000–$3,000/trip; premium experiences growing.
band_aid_solutions: DIY via OTAs and deal apps (Expedia, Booking, Hopper)
Ad-hoc ‘friend who travels a lot’ advice

customer_willingness_to_pay.summary: Moderate-to-high when value is clear (perks, time savings, disruption support). Majority of advisors now charge fees; common $100–$300 for standard trips; complex FIT/group fees can reach $500–$2,500.
signals: >50% of U.S. advisors report charging professional fees; majority in $100–$300 band.
Younger travelers express preference for advisors in surveys (≈38% of Gen Z/Millennials), citing overwhelm; social-led and creator-led trips see paid uptake (e.g., TrovaTrip budgets median ~$2,000).

1_problem_and_demand.insight: Gen Z’s path-to-purchase is social-first and looped; a ‘human + tech’ advisor that meets them on mobile/social, prices transparently, and guarantees disruption support can convert inspiration into booked, higher-yield itineraries.

examples: Nexion, Travel Leaders, Fora, Outside Agents, Travel Quest, Cruise Planners (franchise)
Intrepid, G Adventures, Tauck, Trafalgar; local DMC partners

competitive_gaps: Social-to-booking handoff remains leaky; few seamless advisor-native flows from TikTok/IG to checkout.
Weak real-time ops support in OTAs during IRROPS; Gen Z wants fast human help.
AI tools exist but lack advisor-quality curation and negotiated perks.
Transparent, modular fees for Gen Z (pay for planning/support only) are rare.
market_dynamics: Agency channel at record volumes; NDC/ancillaries complicate DIY and favor advisors.
Social discovery and creator economy steer destination demand; women and younger travelers drive group travel.
AI planning rising but trust remains with human validation; intent high for AI-enable booking but adoption lags.
Preference drift toward direct brand booking for some products during holidays; nonetheless, OTAs still dominate online lodging booking share.
2_market_and_competition.opportunity_insight: Win where OTAs are weakest: trusted curation + live support, and compress the ‘inspiration-to-booking’ gap native to Gen Z social behaviors.

regulatory_and_compliance_risks: Seller of Travel registration/bonding in CA, FL (incl. independent agent filings), HI, WA; display requirements.
DOT 2024–2026 refund rules: ticket agents must refund promptly upon request when flights are canceled/changed; ensure workflows and disclosures comply.
If packaging = potential ‘organizer’ liability (EU-style obligations when selling into EU jurisdictions); use vetted operators/DMCs and appropriate contracts.
E&O insurance cost creep and host-agency policy gaps; PCI/data privacy for payments.
execution_constraints: High-touch service model increases labor per trip; need automation without losing human feel
Seasonality of demand and IRROPS surge load
Acquiring creators/communities with positive unit economics
critical_dependencies: AI itinerary and CRM stack integrated with booking rails
3_feasibility_and_risk.risk_insight: Regulatory and ops risks are manageable via host alignment and narrow trip scope at launch; the bigger risk is CAC>gross margin without a repeatable social-to-booking funnel.

mvp_wedge.wedge: Gen Z-friendly ‘Advisor-in-your-pocket’: DM-to-itinerary within 24 hours for 5-night urban/culture trips to EU/Mex/Caribbean, with transparent planning fee and 24/7 disruption support.
mvp_wedge.why_it_validates_fast: Short cycles, repeatable SKUs, measurable conversion from social DMs; limited supplier set allows perks and SLA guarantees.
mvp_wedge.who_its_for: U.S.-based Gen Z couples/friends booking $1.5k–$3.5k pp trips, mobile-first, socially inspired.

unique_advantage_hypotheses: Social-to-booking rails: link-in-bio trip builders + instant holds + fee checkout in <5 minutes.
Creator collabs with pre-bundled micro-itineraries; affiliate revenue + higher conversion.
AI-assisted curation trained on our supplier notes + traveler prefs; human QA within 24 hours.
Disruption guarantee: proactive rebooking per DOT rules; peace-of-mind as a product.
growth_levers: TikTok/IG creators with revenue share and co-branded itineraries
Referral loops: give-perk/get-perk for friend invites
Narrow destinations with strong consortia perks (VIP amenities increase close rates)
Content SEO on ‘where to go for X vibe’ + UGC trip recaps
Group departures with community leaders (TrovaTrip-style partners)
4_product_and_strategy.strategy_insight: Treat the advisor as a product: fast response, modular fees, mobile-native UX, visible perks, and reliable rescue. Start with a tight lane to raise NPS and margins, then expand SKUs.

why: Demand and intent are strong; advisor channel at records; Gen Z shows willingness to use humans when value is clear.
Behavioral fit (social-led, mobile, AI-assisted) aligns with product vision.
Risk: converting preference into paid planning fees at scale; need proof on CAC:LTV from creator channels.

market_size_reality_check.tam_usd_per_year: $15B–$25B (U.S. Gen Z leisure bookings that could flow via advisors/curated intermediaries, including commissions+fees).
market_size_reality_check.sam_usd_per_year: $1.5B–$3.0B (U.S. Gen Z outbound to EU/Mex/Caribbean, 4–9 night trips, using advisors; assumes 10–15% of Gen Z travelers buy via advisors, avg booking value $2.5k–$4k pp, 2 travelers).
market_size_reality_check.som_usd_per_year_1_to_3_years: $15M–$60M gross bookings; $2.5M–$9M net revenue (commissions+fees), assuming 6–18k travelers/year at $2.5k–$3.5k pp, take rate 14–16% + fees.
assumptions: U.S. Gen Z pop ~68–72M; ~30–40M traveling annually; 10–20% advisor-amenable in next 3 years (preference > actual).
Avg trip budget Gen Z $1.5k–$3.5k pp; 1–2 advisor-suitable trips/year per buyer.
Blended take rate 12–16% commissions + $150–$300 average fee where applied.

adoption_and_behavior_signals: Agency-channel air hit ~$100B+ in 2024–2025; NDC penetration ~20%+ creating complexity that benefits advisors.
Social discovery among U.S. travelers up (≈19% in 2025), with Gen Z highest.
AI usage for travel planning ~15–39% and rising; Gen Z comfortable booking on mobile; creator-led group travel demand skewed to Gen Z/Millennials (≈84% of respondents).

assumptions: Year 1: 1,200–3,500 travelers; AOV $2.7k pp; take rate 15%; 40–60% planning fee attach at $150 avg.
Year 3: 6,000–12,000 travelers via creators + referrals; improved attach and upsells (tours, insurance).

5_market_readiness_and_validation.readiness_insight: Market is receptive; success hinges on proving a low-CAC creator/UGC engine and operational excellence during disruptions.

strengths: Narrow destination focus enables perks and SLAs
weaknesses: Low initial brand trust vs major OTAs
Regulatory overhead across states if scaling direct merchant model
opportunities: NDC/ancillary complexity steering DIY travelers to advisors
Upsell insurance, activities, and VIP amenities to lift take rate
threats: OTAs improving service and social commerce
Regulatory changes on refunds/consumer protections increasing liability
6_swot.swot_insight: Differentiation lives in service speed, disruption guarantees, and social-native funnels—areas incumbents under-serve.

validation_plan.hypothesis: Gen Z will pay $150 planning fee for 5–7 night Mexico/EU city trips with 24h turnaround
validation_plan.method: Creator whitelisting + link-in-bio Typeform + Stripe fee checkout + 5 pre-negotiated itineraries

validation_plan.hypothesis: ‘We rebook you in <30 min’ increases conversion and WTP
validation_plan.method: Two landing pages; measure fee attach and close rate

validation_plan.hypothesis: Creator-hosted small group (10–14 pax) yields CAC <$120/pax and NPS > 70
validation_plan.method: Partner with 2 mid-tier creators; pre-bundled dates

validation_plan.hypothesis: AI assistant cuts planning time by 40% without hurting NPS
validation_plan.method: Internal AI tooling; time-and-motion + CSAT tracking

validation_plan.hypothesis: Tiered fees ($0, $99, $249) maximize net margin and reduce tire-kickers
We can’t profitably acquire without creators
validation_plan.method: Run non-creator paid social; measure CAC/NR
validation_plan.success_metric: If CAC/NR > 1.5 after 2 weeks → pivot heavier to creators/referrals

validation_plan.hypothesis: Gen Z refuses planning fees at MVP price point
validation_plan.success_metric: If waiver yields <5% uplift in close, keep fees; if >20%, revisit pricing/packaging

top_growth_gaps_to_exploit: Social-to-booking gap with instant holds and fee checkout
Disruption support as a productized guarantee
top_risks_to_mitigate_first: CAC creep on paid social; over-reliance on one creator
Host/consortia dependence and unfavorable fee splits
Regulatory compliance across state SOT laws and DOT refund obligations
Ops overload during irregular operations (need 24/7 partners)
open_questions: What fee and perk combo maximizes Gen Z conversion without eroding commission economics?
Which creator verticals (food, outdoor, fashion, wellness) yield best CAC:LTV?
Which destination triad delivers highest close rate and fewest IRROPS (e.g., Mexico/Caribbean vs EU city pairs)?
What SLAs (response, rebooking time) most impact NPS and referrals?
How much AI can we surface to users without reducing perceived human value?
